title: Georgia House - Day 9 (2026-01-25)
summary:
Here is a structured markdown summary of the key points from the Georgia House session transcript:

## Overview
This session featured a prayer and scripture reading by the guest chaplain, Lieutenant Colonel Andy Parker, who encouraged the House members to uphold the values of justice, mercy, and humility in their legislative work. No substantive legislation was mentioned.

## Key Actions
None detected.

## Bills Introduced (First Reading)
None detected.

## Notable Moments
- Lt. Col. Andy Parker, the guest chaplain, delivered a speech urging the House members to "do justly, love mercy, and walk humbly" in their legislative duties.
- The House recognized Lt. Col. Parker's 27 years of military service and upcoming retirement.

## Votes
No recorded votes mentioned.

## Attendance
The session began with a quorum call and members were instructed to vote green to signify their presence.

## Adjournment
The transcript does not explicitly state when the session was adjourned. The next session date is also not provided.
